alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:36PM EST until December 20 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Chenango and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Owego affecting Tioga County. Susquehanna River Near Windsor affecting Broome County. Chenango River At Chenango Forks affecting Broome County. Chenango River At Sherburne affecting Chenango County. Chenango River At Greene affecting Chenango County. Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. Susquehanna River At Towanda affecting Bradford County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Bainbridge. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding occurs in the low lying areas across the river from Bainbridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM EST.
